div1.p: William Lazear arrives safely. He gives news of relatives.

div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, May 24, 1872
div1.p:
I have time to say
a small say before going down to
the Boat

Reached here an hour behind
time -- A very kind old
gentleman who had a thoughtful
wife at home -- shared his
Breakfast with me on the
Cars -- and this has sufficed
me -- until the sumptuous
supper I expect on the Boat,

-- Brother Tom looks very
much worn out -- Has been
night and day preparing
for a suit in the U.S. Court
which he tried and gained
today -- He says that
Alice is in considerable
distress -- and dont yet
know what the trouble is
-- Aunt Catherine Droosey is
here -- and expects to go home
tomorrow night --

I have been busy among
our grow friends -- and use
a little summer
I called to see Mr MCallum

-- They are in the country more
and he says are well as
could be expected

-- Give much love to Ma
and Kiss our darling boys
and take good care of
yourself for
